description: Numbers with property that every divisor (except 1) contains the digit 8.
comments: Subsequence of A011538, numbers with an 8. - _Michel Marcus_, Nov 21 2015
example: 7387 has divisors 83, 89 and 7387, all of which contain the digit 8
mathematica: fQ[n_, dgt_] := Union[ MemberQ[#, dgt] & /@ IntegerDigits@ Rest@ Divisors@ n][[1]]; Select[ Range[2, 1900], fQ[#, 8] &] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Jun 11 2014 *)Select[Prime[Range[350]], !StringFreeQ[ToString[#], "8"] &] (* _Vincenzo Librandi_, Nov 21 2015 *)
prog: (MAGMA) [p: p in PrimesUpTo(2000) |  8 in Intseq(p)]; // _Vincenzo Librandi_, Nov 21 2015
author: _Erich Friedman_, Jul 04 2001
